intro: Hibbertia desmophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with prominent stamens. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and has a woody stem with alternate, narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Hibbertia desmophylla is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to tolerate salt spray and coastal conditions. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in ecological and horticultural studies.
